reviewText:
Somewhere in between love gone wrong, opportunities missed, bad grades and relationships fading, you gradually lost pieces of your heart and the small bits of innocent belief that a better world could be. But your angina decay went so slowly you could not be aware at the time.

Time. You had all the time in the world. Time to find any solution to any mind or heartache presented to you. Time to waste. Time to enjoy.

Now you know how precious time is. But even more, you are painfully aware of how precious any pipe-dream solution to get those bits and pieces back are. Because you are still looking for them and your body cells have long since started to decompose more rapidly than they renew, and your hair is thinning and graying like it's a race to the finish line.

Today you live among hipster d0uchebags hating on anything older than an hour of existence, pathetic script kiddies on your lawn leaving snarky internet comments everywhere they go, sold-out parents with their fake smiles and monster mortgage, and everyone generally pretending to enjoy life after the innocence of their childhood went away forever.

And however faint your hope, you alone still struggle with the idea that somewhere there has to be a key, a door, or even the tiniest of glimpse, back to those wonderful years. And you would again, just for a brief moment, be able to enjoy a full, red heart behind your now and forever dusty, weathered rib cage.

This game, then, is my gift to you.

It's for all of the snowmen and snow castles in life that you wanted to build, but never could because of lack of talent or not winning the gene lottery. It's for all the sled rides that didn't have a deadline connected with them, only the sheer joy of feeling the wind in your hair as you lost your mittens and scarf, going so fast down the hill your parents would have a heart attack if they saw it. And nothing could rival the biggest, burning smile that stemmed from your soul and materialized in full between your ears.

It's for your kids, to enjoy something else than generic Zombie Killer Survivalz, Call of Modern Warfare Crapsh|t Ultimate Edition 3, or FIFA Overpaid License Game Lawyer Edition.

It's pure and simple, in the most beautiful of forms. It's for you to take a sneak peak at and play after the kids have gone to bed and you no longer have to pretend to be an adult anymore. It's for you to link back to a better time with. It's for all your hopes and dreams that went away so easily, but were ever so hard to grasp once more, or even replay in your mind.

Marvin's Mittens will grab hold of your wrinkled hand, and inch by snowy inch it will carry you through what you initially thought would be some small panels of hand drawn images, but turning out to be as close to a Winter Holiday with Calvin and Hobbes that you will ever be so lucky to get.

Go and play in the snow. Lose a mitten or two along with your worries. It will mend your silly, old, tired heart and it will make you smile - for real this time.
voteText: 29 of 30 people (97%) found this review helpful 5 people found this review funny

reviewText: One of the most amazing things about Marvin's Mittens is how perfectly it captures the magic of playing outside in the snow in deep winter. It hit me almost immediately: The colours, the sounds, even the isolation. But it's not just for children, and in fact I'd say the incredible sense of nostalgia it engenders makes it more appropriate, and almost certainly more effective, for adults.\n\nCharming" is probably an overused adjective in game reviews (or at least on the backs of boxes)
date: but if any game deserves to wave that flag
recommended: Marvin's Mittens is it. It's not a difficult game
voteText: and it's not going to put your platforming skills to the test. But it is an immensely satisfying experience that recreates a childlike sense of wonder and exploration like nothing else I've ever played."

reviewText:
2 words spring to mind - unbridled joy. This game is  a delightful experience - more something you play with as opposed to just play through. Marvin makes a great embodiment of my inner child and his joy is my joy; his angst at being called home to bed - aaaaaw..... is mine as well. It is so refreshing to explore his world with him and fly as he flies. Each small triumph is a huge victory. The art style is brilliant. Music so suited. Voices just bang-on. Game controls well once you get into it.

What are you waiting for?  Let's play!!!

HIGHLY recommend.

reviewText: This game is pure magic! I sat down to play for a few minutes, and before I knew it hours had passed. reviewText:
This game is a beautiful hand drawn winter themed platformer.

Entirely child friendly - there is absolutely no aggression, killing, death, fear or anything like that.

Its a journey around the countryside near the house Marvin lives. The goal is to find our mittens some mysterious being stole from us.

As an experienced gamer it took me about 4 hours to 100% complete the game and compared to the price I think it has a fair amount of content. Little kids probably have to play much longer to find everything.
This game is entirely child friendly but that doesnt mean adults cant enjoy it. Usually I play co-op and multi fps games and other stuff far from being family friendly and still played the whole game inside of a day after started it simply cuz it felt good.

Like the drawing the music is beautiful too so it is worth considering to buy the Soundtrack Edition.
voteText: 10 of 11 people (91%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
If there were any more snowflakes to collect, I'd still be playing right now.

This little gem is just pure magic. I don't think I've ever enjoyed a platformer this much in my entire life. The story itself is nothing to write home about; one of Marvin's mittens got stolen and he's looking for it every day. The execution however is top-notch. Everything from the simple but rewarding progression to the music score, voice acting, level design, you name it, were all very well done.

The only (minor) grip I had with the game was the automatic saving system that got in the way of snowflake-hunting more than once by throwing Marvin back home at more-or-less regular intervals. I think I would've liked a disable option for this but I have to admit that it added its own little charm. Moreover, as traveling from map to map got faster, it didn't really bother me.

Overall, I'd say the experience was worth every cent. Absolutely loved it. I can well imagine myself returning to this game in the future.
voteText: 8 of 8 people (100%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Even almost a year after the last time I played Marvin's Mittens, I still vividly remember how beautiful this game was. This little jump & run gem is full of joy, nostalgia and heart-warming moments.

Some people may say this is for children only, and I very much disagree. I honestly believe that if you're an adult and can't find enjoyment in playing this, something's wrong with you.

The game will take you around 4 to 5 hours to complete and yes, I wish it were a bit longer. However, in my opinion it's still worth buying it at full price, and after completing Marvin's Mittens I actually bought the soundtrack to throw more money at the devs.

If you're looking for a game to get yourself into the winter holidays mood, this one is it.

reviewText:
Great game for kids that are still in the age group of believing in Santa Clause.

Controls are good, sound and presentation of the art style is tasteful.
Has a cute story to follow and a few collectible things along the way.

It comes with a nice pacing feature that auto-saves the game and stops the player every so often, not good for hardcore playing since that isn't what the game is meant for but again, perfect for children.
voteText: 14 of 21 people (67%) found this review helpful

reviewText: An adorable, beautifully animated plaformer with a wonderful soundtrack that just wraps you in its magic from start to finish. You collect snowflakes scattered throughout the level, each of which lets you jump higher to get to some previously unreachable places, make drawings of various animals and birds, ride your sleigh, open shortcuts and come back home when your mom calls for you. It's not hard and rather short, but everything in this game works exactly as it should, and the amount of heart put into it makes exploring its world a pure joy.\nI haven't seen a better game for spending winter holidays with your kid or going back into childhood yourself.
voteText: 5 of 6 people (83%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
If you're looking for a Christmas game this should be your pick. It's adorable, relaxing and nostalgic.

From a gameplay viewpoint it's platforming isn't the tightest but that works to it's advantage. As you collect snowflakes throughout the world your double jump gets longer and longer until your flying, rewarding the collect-omaniac and the child inside you both at once. My only crititism is that sometimes Marvin doesn't turn as quick as you want him to but in this game you don't need quick reactions.

Perfect for kids and pretty good for adults who aren't dead inside too.
voteText: 7 of 10 people (70%) found this review helpful

reviewText: This game is in many ways a fun, exploration platformer for kids. But I'm pushing 30 and have no kids, and I loved it. The art, music and general ambience make for a delightful couple of hours taking Marvin through the countryside and pushing further and further (with some helpful shortcuts!) before your mom calls you in for the night. I thought the mechanism of playing in 10-15 minute or so spurts would be annoying, but the system is so seamless it doesn't really take away from the game at all. In fact, it gives it that childlike sense of I wonder what cool stuff I'll see tomorrow?"\n\nDefinitely a buy."

reviewText: The concept of non-violent game is very good, but the game is too difficult for the kids in some parts. The game would be better if its difficulty would be manageable for for kids 5-7 years old. In its current state help of an adult is required to progress in it (and in some places the required jumps were unforgiving even for me).\n\nGreat idea, but the level designer forgot that he is making a game for kids.

reviewText: That was a real, sincere, delight to play this game. Its principle is rather simple, you explore beautiful snowy landscapes and collect snowflakes to jump higher and higher, so that you could access to an increasing number of places (and eventually fly to the moon... almost). I initially chose Marvin's Mittens to introduce video games to my 4 and 5-year-old kids, but I haven't slept this night, because I could not resolve myself to leave Marvin and his enchanted world.\nIf you are sick of playing 5-million dollars video games with zombies, murders, betrayal, just BUY IT!

reviewText:
So simple, so charming, so relaxing! I loved this game!

Pros:
1. Simple concept that captures the feeling of being a kid exploring in the snow during winter time.
2. The artwork/style was very good.
3. Very relaxing
4. Great atmosphere
5. Great sound
6. Surprising and, at times, unexpected scapes

Cons:
1. Very easy (I honestly wouldn't change this though)
2. Short (I probably wouldn't change this either.)

Just a charming, simple game that honeslty caught me unawares by how much I enjoyed it. With a cute storyline, enjoyable yet minimalistic gameplay progression, and overall great almost nostalgic atmosphere, I can't recommend this enough. Get this game!
voteText: 1 person found this review helpful

reviewText:
I did it. Before spring comes. Before sun is destroying the charme of this beautiful game. I do not recommend it, playing in summertimes. BUT:
This game is a kindhearted jewel, when you play it in winter times, best time should be before christmas, when the is snow everywhere. It's a game for kids ... and for adults, which have a sentimental memory of their childhood. The graphics beautiful handdrawn, Marvin, the leading character is lovely animated and walks like a child eager to detect nature and his imaginations where mittens and cocoa play a large role.
The gameplay is like a jump n'run where ou collect snowflakes to reach a better and higher performance in your jumps; the music fits best to the scenery and is really worth listening - even the save-sleep-rest song, which you hear more often than you like, because after 5-10 minutes of gameplay, Marvin is called by his mother to go to bed (good idea for limiting the playtime for younger ones). Marvin jumps, collects, discovers animals and what the hell is going on with these mittens.
For me it was a very nice game experience, where the main gameplay is often loosened by funny ideas: who has detected all the funny things: the dragon, the frozen pirate ship, the rocky flying mitten, the eagle on top of the Taller Mountain and at last even the reindeer?
Voila, I recommend this game in its whole (besides the limited playtime before going to bed) as a lovely heart-touching one in times where action and power take center in every corner. And if you do not like to drink so much cocoa like Marvin, just try to read the Elfcyclopedia, it's worth it!

Playtime: 5-6 hours if you want all stars. No achievements, but trading cards!

reviewText:
This game is about the cutest thing I've ever seen.  If you have children between 6 to 8 years old, this is a perfect platformer for them to get started on.  The graphics, atmosphere, music, and the little bit of writing and dialog that there are, all add up to make a great child's game.
There are no bad guys to defeat, no pits of spikes to traverse and no health bar or damage from falling from too high: simply the wonder of discovery as Marvin wanders out of his backyard in search of his stolen mitten.  Along the way, he meets magical elves who aid in his quest.  Marvin occasionally spies small animals, and if he moves slowly, he can whip out his sketchbook and draw a picture of them.
After about ten or fifteen minutes of playing, Mom calls Marvin back to the house for bed at which point she hums a short lullaby and gives the opportunity to save progress and quit.
The only con is that the last couple of levels, or screens, have one or two really difficult spots for small kids to handle.  It will probably require an adult or older sibling to get the child to the very end and discover who stole Marvin's mitten.  But the simple and heartwarming ending is well worth the effort.

reviewText: An absolutely beautifully done game in which you play little Marvin and have to find his mitten. By collecting snowflakes you are able to jump higher and higher in order to finally catch the mitten's thief. This ability makes the game extremely enjoyable as there is immediate progress with every snowflake you catch and pretty addictive also! The soundtrack, the graphics and the storyline are just incredibly sweet and enchanting, the perfect game to play to get into the Christmas spirit (or to play at any other point of time in the year) and to relive sweet childhood memories. I already played it second time now and I really warmly recommend it!

reviewText: Marvin's Mittens is a magical adventure into the mind of a child at play during winter. You guide Marvin through a winter wonderland, no danger involved. reviewText:
A beautifully happy game that's lovely for children. It's also great for adults that are tired of, or dislike, tense, frantic games with maddeningly heavy music and every sort of creature that's lurking with evil thoughts running rampant, all centering around your demise.

Did I mention there's forest critters to find? No, not to stalk, shoot, or eat. You get to be friends with them! What a heartwarming idea that'll inordinately thrill every time one is gently discovered.

This beautiful romp is through hand-drawn scenes which perfectly capture the innocence and imagination of childhood. Didn't have one of those? Childhood, I mean. Do yourself a favour and buy this. Experience one!

Some areas requires the extended float jump which only is available after completing the game once which is a plus and rewards curious minds. reviewText:
First of all, I have to say this game isn't just a game for little children.
It is a game for the hole family in the cold winter days. I bought this game in December 2014 and played it since then every year in
Decebmber.

Marvin's Mittens is a jump and run game made with love form the developer.
The game principle is very simple.
Every day the little Marvin is out in the nature to find his lost mitten.
After one (ingame) day, his mom is calling back home.
Then he goes to sleep and on the next day it starts again.
On his way he will find snowfleeks that help him fly for a short time.
The more snowfleeks you collect, the longer you can fly.
Also the controls are realy easy to master.
(I prefer to play with a XBox 360 Controler but I also played it with mouse and keyboard.)

All in all,
it has so many nice and heard warming moments that it is worth buying and playing.
voteText: No ratings yet

reviewText:
This game is amazing.
Marvin's Mittens is a short platformer that has you running around outside collecting snowflakes and looking for Marvin's lost mitten across snowy landscapes.
But it's not the gameplay that makes MM. As silly as it sounds, it's about the magic of the whole experience that really makes you feel like a kid again, staring with awe at the winter world around you.
Snow everywhere, towering pine trees, luminous caves, mountain peaks, the occasional animal, and even elves!
I launched steam, opened up the game, put away my phone, put my earbuds in, and forgot about the rest of the world (if only for a couple hours).
If you like Calvin and Hobbes, think of all the magical adventures Calvin had out in the snow with his tiger friend and then put that into game form.
I don't have much else to say. I could never be cynical about something that works this well.
This game'll melt your heart with a cup of hot chocolate and then put it to bed. See you in the morning!
